text: What I wanted to do was to search in a list and remove a value .
So I wrote the following code

code:
for x in range(10):
   if x in list1:
      list1.remove(x)

text: Does this function of order ~ (n^2) since first it looks for the value and then it deletes and pushes the rest of the values backwards ?
Also is there a way to turn this in order n by using try/except

code:
try:
  for x in range(10):
    list1.remove(x)
except ValueError:
  # make it go back to next iteration
